captions.text: - Yes, I have been broken up with.
- I've been broken up with so many times.
- I have, yes, I have been broken up with.

Man, I remember my high
school girlfriend dumped me.
Ugh, I was so sad.
- Finding out that she hooked up
with someone more successful than me.
(laughter)

- Uh, my girlfriend
gave me a homemade quilt
that took her, like six months to make,

and then broke up with
me like an hour later.

Uh, that was a strange--cause
I, like I didn't know

what the hell to do with
the quilt after that.

- We were at a cast party
for a musical that we were in
and just like, halfway through,

because I said something weird,
she goes, "We're through."
And I thought she was joking.

I was like, "Oh! What?
When did that happen?"
- Worst way I did it was via e-mail.

And it was definitely on
some, like, childish stuff

because I was cheating, I
knew I was in the wrong,

so I was kinda like,
"How am I gonna finagle
"my way out of this thing?"
- It was throughout the entire
evening of the Homecoming Dance.
Both the dinner before, during the dance,

and then for an hour
after the dance was over.

I tried to convince someone
that we weren't dating.

In general, it was--I should
of just waited one more day,
just let the girl have a fun Homecoming,

but I couldn't do that because
I was too much of a jerk.

- The worst way I've ever
broken up with someone
is taking a vacation with another girl.

- I remember one time
trying to go on a date
and be the most awful version of myself

for the person to try
and break up with me.

That's just--that's not
a good way to do things.
- I walked in after a ski trip
and handed her this little wooden frog
and then said, "Uh, I'm going to sleep
"on my buddy John's couch. It's over."
And that was that.

We didn't really talk
again for, like, two years.
- I think when you stop communicating.
- If you feel like it would be easier
to just hang out with them miserably
than it would be to break up with them,
that's a good sign to break up with them.
(heavy sigh)
- I think, it's time to break up

when you're trying to
figure out how to break up.
- There's no one that knows like,
"Oh, this relationship has run its course.

"Let's get out now while we're
both still happy with it."
It's like a relationship has to get into

this murky, soggy, gross
period before you both

have the courage to be like,
"This is bad, isn't it?"

comments.text:
My ex-boyfriend behaved for like 4 days like a real asshole while we were 
together and then broke up with me for no reason, maybe he had one maybe he 
didn't. He just haven’t told me. I was kinda angry because he behaved like 
an asshole and then broke up saying on whatsapp that he has no feelings for 
me any longer and idk i texted back that it is okay and that I never really 
liked the way he treated me, like I didn't feel like being in a 
relationship with him all time time we were together because he never 
kissed me. I had to kiss him and I have to admit that that's really 
frustrating.
Plus he did not talk very much and he always wanted me to tell him things 
but after frikin' 3 hours talking, 5 days a week I just can't talk 3 hours 
again. Just no. He was sweet and really protective and stuff but I replied 
with telling him exactly what I wrote down here, only in other words.
Today I found out that his grandpa died but he did not tell me. He died one 
day before my birthday and I was really shocked because I've asked him 
about his day and what's going on everytime I felt like asking it because 
of his behavior but he didn't tell me. His cousin told me that he was 
really down and crying and stuff, treating the others in another way as 
usual and being a dick. I feel so sorry now because maybe he acted because 
of that and instead of that I told him what he did wrong. I just don't know 
how to feel about it. I feel like an asshole even if my friends told me 
that I'm not and even after his cousin told me I acted way nicer than he at 
the and.﻿

comments.author: The doll craver

comments.text:
I dated a girl for 2.5 years. One day I told her I didn't feel happy 
anymore, and she wasn't either. We tried to fix it for about 2 weeks and we 
finally decided to break up. That was 4 months ago, and I'm still going 
through the stages or hysterical crying and wanting her back. We made the 
best memories and she gave me the best 2 and a half years of my life, and 
I'm so glad I got to experience falling in love with someone as amazing as 
her. Moral of the story; I was the happiest I've ever been in my life up 
until the last part, and even though it hurts I'm forever grateful I got to 
share that happiness with someone else.﻿

comments.author: Jill patunia

comments.text:
We all sometimes lose sight of what consequences are actions have. We have 
all experienced how it feels to be on the other side of a hurtful 
relationship. We probably all have caused hurt too. I think the best thing 
is to remember the hurt you have felt, not to feel the pain but so that you 
don't hurt others. Because the best we can do is just to treat others the 
way we wished we had been treated.... let the dark days be few and far 
between but let them never be forgotten so that the light days seem just 
that bit brighter. ﻿

comments.author: mean teen

comments.text:
I've had a few types of heartbreak. I've had the typical first breakup 
where you're devastated and all you do is cry a lot. Then there's the other 
time when you're actually fine with the breakup, then figure out that 
you're not when they move on. There's also the classic one where you think 
someone uses you to get their ex jealous. However, I think one of the worst 
heartbreaks is one over something that almost happened. When you meet 
someone that really clicks with you and there is just that spark that could 
really start something. Then, it doesn't happen, and you have to pretend 
that those feelings were never there, even though they still are.﻿

comments.text:

to be in any relationship because of possible breakups. Relationships are 
part of life, and are a beautiful thing to be into, and even if you don't 
ever get to be in one, life will still mess you up. Life is chaos, and it 
will possibly make you miserable, so at times it's better not to stand 
alone.﻿
